conclusion: The electromotive force of the power supply is E=6V, the internal resistance is r=2Ω, the fixed resistors are R1=2Ω, R2=3Ω, R3=6Ω, and the capacitance of the capacitor is C=10μF.
After closing switch S, the circuit stabilizes.
The resistors R2 and R3 are in parallel. The equivalent resistance R23 is given by: 1/R23 = 1/R2 + 1/R3 = 1/3 + 1/6 = 2/6 + 1/6 = 3/6 = 1/2, so R23 = 2Ω.
The total resistance R_total in the circuit is the sum of R1, R23, and the internal resistance r: R_total = R1 + R23 + r = 2 + 2 + 2 = 6Ω.
The current I in the circuit is given by Ohm's Law: I = E/R_total = 6V/6Ω = 1A.
The voltage across R23 is: V23 = I × R23 = 1A × 2Ω = 2V.
The voltage across the capacitor VC is the same as the voltage across R23 because they are in parallel: VC = V23 = 2V.
The charge Q on the capacitor is given by: Q = C × VC = 10 × 10^-6 F × 2V = 20 × 10^-6 C = 20μC.
